question: Which are the two independent countries that were earlier part of the "New France" between 1534 and 1763?
option3: United States of America and Canada
answer: United States of America and Canada
explanation: New France, also known as the French North American Empire or Royal New France, was the area colonized by France in North America, which includes the USA and Canada, beginning with the exploration of the Gulf of Saint Lawrence by Jacques Cartier in 1534 and ending with the cession of New France to Great Britain and Spain in 1763 under the Treaty of Paris of 1763. It extended from Newfound land to the Canadian Prairies and from Hudson Bay to the Gulf of Mexico, including all the Great Lakes of North America.
